subdisciplines.name: Performance Art
subdisciplines.description: An interdisciplinary art form that combines dance, theater, visual art, and music into a single performance.

subdisciplines.name: Performance Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of theoretical frameworks for analyzing and understanding the processes, meanings, and effects of performance

subdisciplines.name: Performance History
subdisciplines.description: The study of the history of performance as a cultural practice, including its social, political, and economic contexts

subdisciplines.name: Performance Ethnography
subdisciplines.description: The use of ethnographic methods to study performance as a cultural practice, including participant observation, interviews, and archival research

subdisciplines.name: Performance and Technology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the intersections of performance and technology, including digital media, virtual reality, and interactive installations

subdisciplines.name: Performance and Social Justice
subdisciplines.description: The study of the relationship between performance and social justice, including activism, protest, and community-based performance

subdisciplines.name: Dance Studies
subdisciplines.description: The study of various forms of dance and their cultural significance within society.

subdisciplines.name: Theatre Studies
subdisciplines.description: The study of theatrical performances, including staging, directing, acting, and design.
